title: Black Bean Soup

Soup Base: 1 whole red bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 whole green bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 whole yellow bell pepper, seeded and diced

steps: Place the beans in a bowl or pot, cover with cold water, and allow to soak overnight OR add beans to a medium pot and cover with hot water; bring to a boil, then boil for 2 minutes. Turn off the heat, cover the pot, and allow the beans to sit for 1 hour. Drain the beans and rinse them with cold water.
In a medium pot, add beans, chicken stock, water, onions, and bell peppers; bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
Add salt, chili powder, and cumin, and stir. Cover and continue simmering for another 30 minutes to 1 hour, until the liquid level is to your liking.
Taste for seasoning and add more of what it needs.
Serve soup in bowls topped with sour cream, extra diced bell pepper, avocado, cilantro, tortilla strips, and a lime wedge.
